name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Barrier materials (Standard W-Section)
Acceptance Criteria - To be supplied, fabricated and protected in accordance with the drawings and specification.
○ W-section to comply with MASH TL-3
Specification Reference - PS Cl 22.1.1 NZTA M23
Verifying Document - Docket, Manufacturer's Drawings/install instructions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Barrier materials (End Terminals W-Section)
Acceptance Criteria - To be supplied, fabricated and protected in accordance with the drawings and specification.
○ Leading End Terminals to comply with MASH TL-3
○ Trailing End Terminals to comply with MASH TL-3
Specification Reference - PS Cl 22.1.4 NZTA M23
Verifying Document - Docket, Manufacturer's Drawings/install instructions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - Contractor to provide Concrete Design Mix information to the Engineer. 30MPa Mix
Specification Reference - PS Section 24 Per Manufacturer Specifications
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Barrier materials (Thrie Beam)
Acceptance Criteria - To be supplied, fabricated and protected in accordance with the drawings and specification.
Specification Reference - PS Cl 22.1.1 NZTA M23
Verifying Document - Docket, Manufacturer's Drawings/install instructions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Barrier materials (Thrie Beam Transitions)
Acceptance Criteria - To be supplied, fabricated and protected in accordance with the drawings and specification.
Specification Reference - PS Cl 22.1.3 NZTA M23
Verifying Document - Docket, Manufacturer's Drawings/install instructions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Barrier materials (Wire Rope)
Acceptance Criteria - To be supplied, fabricated and protected in accordance with the drawings and specification.
○ Wire Rope to comply with MASH TL-4.
Specification Reference - PS Cl 22.1.1/22.1.8 NZTA M23
Verifying Document - Docket, Manufacturer's Drawings/install instructions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - Contractor to provide Concrete Design Mix information to the Engineer. 30MPa Mix
Specification Reference - PS Section 24 Per Manufacturer Specifications
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Ground beam installation (Pre-Pour)

Acceptance Criteria - A concrete pre-pour inspection to be carried out by Engineer to check formwork and reinforced steel (where required), checking dimensions, reo sizes as well as ground preparation.
○ Concrete strength requirement of 30MPa minimum. Specification from NZTA 2014 Technical Memorandum: Road Safety Hardware Series Standard Detail Ground Beam
Verifying Document - Pre-pour Inspection Sheet, Concrete Docket, Photos
Frequency - Prior to every concrete pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Ground beam installation (Post-Pour)
Acceptance Criteria - Post pour inspeection to check concrete finishes are up to the required specification. No honeycoming. Any defects to be reported to the Engineer with remediation proposal.
Verifying Document - Post-pour Inspection Sheet, Concrete testing results, Photos
Frequency - After stripping formwork on each concrete pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - W-beam postioning behind kerb

Acceptance Criteria - Unless detailed in the drawings, where barrier is placed behind a kerb, the face of the barrier is to be no more than 200mm behind the kerb face. Where barrier is placed further than 200mm behind the kerb face this shall be agreed on site with the Engineer prior to installation.
Verifying Document - Engineer Inspection / Measurements Photos
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Nesting W-beam barrier
Acceptance Criteria - Nesting of weak post systems shall be in accordance with manufacturer's instructions.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Installer Checklist

Acceptance Criteria - An approved barrier installation checklist shall be completed by a person with demonstrable recent experence in barrier installation and signed by the Contractor for each barrier installed and provided to the Engineer within four weeks of installation.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey Pick-up
Acceptance Criteria - Installed as per the contract drawings
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Terminal End (Pre-Pour)
Acceptance Criteria - A concrete pre-pour inspection to be carried out with the Engineer to check dimensions of trench, formwork and reinforcing, anchor points and ground preparation.
Verifying Document - Pre-pour Inspection Sheet, Concrete Docket, Photos
Frequency - Prior to every concrete pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Terminal End (Post-Pour)
Acceptance Criteria - Post pour inspeection to check top surface finish and ensure anchor points are in place
Verifying Document - Post-pour Inspection Sheet, Concrete testing results, Photos
Frequency - After stripping formwork on every concrete pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Installer Checklist

Acceptance Criteria - An approved barrier installation checklist shall be completed and signed by the Contractor for each barrier installed and provided to the Engineer within four weeks of installation.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey Pick-up
Acceptance Criteria - Installed as per the contract drawings
